mealPrepInfo.groceryList:
1. 500g lean lamb, trimmed
2. 1 tablespoon olive oil
3. 2 large onions, finely chopped
4. 3 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, grated
6. 1 teaspoon turmeric
7. 2 teaspoons cumin
8. 1 teaspoon paprika
9. 1 teaspoon cinnamon
10. 400g can of diced tomatoes
11. 500ml low-sodium chicken stock
12. 2 tablespoons fresh coriander, finely chopped
13. 2 tablespoons fresh parsley, finely chopped
14. Salt and pepper to taste
15. Juice of 1 fresh lemon
mealPrepInfo.cookingMethod:
1. Trim excess fat off lamb and season generously with salt and pepper.
2. Preheat a pan over medium-high heat, add a spritz of oil.
3. Add lamb to the pan and sear on all sides until browned, about 4 minutes per side.
4. Remove seared lamb from pan and set aside.
5. Lower heat to medium, add a spritz more of oil to the pan.
6. Dice onions finely and add to the pan, saut√© until browned.
7. Add curry paste to the pan, stir well to mix with onions and let cook for 2 minutes.
8. Return seared lamb to the pan, stir well to coat in curry mixture.
9. Add enough water to just cover the lamb, bring to a boil.
10. Once boiling, reduce heat to low, cover pan and let it simmer for 1 hour.
11. After 1 hour, check lamb for tenderness. If needed, cook for additional 15 minutes.
12. Divide cooked curry into 5 portions. Serve hot with rice or naan.
